content.description: the crux is the extension with the left hand to the high left crimp on the shady side and then transitioning over to the shady side of the boulder.Â
content.protection: two pads is suggested, one will work with a spotter
content.location: the start is on the arete of the slab and the shady face, right hand on the low undercling with right foot bellow it on the small shelf, and left hand on the high crimp for Gunslingers start and left foot and a small thin shelf directly bellow the left hand. start low and extend all the way up to the massive shelf on the right side with the right hand, rock over and match on the shelf then frog leg the arete and get the high left hand crimp and the high left foot, stand up and rock over to the shady face then move left hand to the higher crimp or left hand side pull above the crimp and get the right hand on the first left hand crimp and stand up and top out to the left side of the boulder.

content.description: the crux is the left hand to the sharp two finger sidepull and standing on the left foot to get a high right foot and the first right crimp.
content.protection: two pads are suggested but one will work
content.location: Gunslinger is in the most shaded area of the boulder with all the trees. The start is right hand on the first crimp and left hand on the small compression flake, left foot on the bottom rail and right on a white jib.

content.description: shaded just about all day on two sides of the boulder, one face has a sketchy landing zone, so please have a spotter present. About 10-15 feet high, sandstone so some parts of the boulder are still a bit sketchy.
